page.title: 15Mary Smith, dialect poet
page.content: Mary Smith was born in Weeton nearly 80 years ago, one of twelve children. She left the village school at the age of 13, having had only one day's absence. For forty years she kept the village shop, which had to close in l975. She loves the village and has never wished to move away. It has always been a closely-knit community and the people have always been ready to help each other. A major change was the opening of the village hall in l920. This provided a meeting place for the villagers other than the pub and the open air. She writes dialect poetry and is a member of the Lancashire Authors' Association and Lancashire Dialect Society. She has published some of her poems and appeared on radio and TV.
